circumstances: Shot while wearing press badge and carrying cameras
notes: Raven Geary, US citizen independent journalist, injured by less-lethal force. Weapon: pepper_ball. Injury: facial wound, bleeding, bruising. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions. First of two documented incidents - shot again on Sept 26 (T4-035).

circumstances: Narrowly avoided eye injury by inches
notes: Leigh Kunkel, US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Weapon: pepper_balls. Injury: back-of-head and nose strikes. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

circumstances: Officers fired from roof into peaceful crowd; grenade landed nearby; projectile destroyed acoustic guitar
notes: Autumn Hamer, US citizen nearby resident, mother, injured by less-lethal force. Weapon: rubber_bullets, pepper_balls, flash_bang. Injury: disorientation, ear ringing. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

circumstances: First-person video captured agent firing at close range
notes: Enrique Bahena, US citizen activist, injured by less-lethal force. Weapon: pepper_ball_launcher. Injury: throat strike with noxious smoke. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

Brian Rivera, injured by less-lethal force. Weapon: pepper_balls. Injury: hit in chest and shoulder. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

circumstances: Veterans training recalled involuntarily
notes: Curtis Evans, 65-year-old US citizen military veteran, injured by less-lethal force. Weapon: tear_gas. Injury: exposure causing panic response. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

circumstances: Federally charged in October with conspiracy to impede officer
notes: Joselyn Walsh, injured by less-lethal force. Weapon: 40mm_baton_round. Injury: projectile penetrated guitar and struck leg. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

Joe Botello, 37, Texas-born US citizen, was awakened at 5:30am when ICE agents broke through his door during raid led personally by DHS Secretary Kristi Noem. Handcuffed and led out. Released after scanning his driver's license. Noem shared video on social media showing Botello handcuffed without noting he was a US citizen. Part of Operation Midway Blitz. Chicago Tribune demanded Noem apologize.
Restaurant worker put in chokehold during workplace enforcement. Lost consciousness, aspirated vomit. Emergency intubation at hospital. Three-week hospitalization. Permanent vocal cord damage.

circumstances: Detained while videotaping agents; pursuing legal action for assault and wrongful arrest
notes: Debbie Brockman, US citizen WGN-TV employee, injured by less-lethal force. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

Maria Greeley, 44, US citizen born at Illinois Masonic Hospital, was surrounded by 3 masked ICE agents on her way home from work. Zip-tied and interrogated for 1 hour despite having US passport. Agents said she 'doesn't look like' a Greeley and called her a liar. Congressman Krishnamoorthi called for accountability.

circumstances: Shot while saying 'We come in peace' at waterfront near Coast Guard base; plans lawsuit
notes: Pastor Jorge Bautista, US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Weapon: pepper_powder. Injury: facial burns, difficulty breathing, hospital treatment. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

outcome: ACLU and human rights groups demand facility closure
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Detained teenager 'Samuel' told lawyers he was beaten so severely he sustained injuries across body, lost consciousness, taken to hospital by ambulance. Another detainee: 'slammed against the ground, handcuffed, taken outside for stepping out of line in the dining hall' with guards nearly breaking his wrists. Opened August 2025 despite warnings. Former Japanese internment site. 60+ federal standard violations in first 50 days. 2,700+ detainees - largest center. DHS disputed claims but Senator Ossoff investigation received 510 credible reports of abuse across 25 states.
source_name: ACLU / Human Rights Watch / Senator Ossoff Investigation

notes: US citizen (born in Laurel, MD hospital) with dual Mexican citizenship. Arrested heading home from Taco Bell. Sister shouted she was born in US but agents ignored. ICE disputed citizenship despite birth certificate. Detained 25 days. Federal judge prohibited deportation Dec 18, released Jan 7, 2026.

circumstances: 79-year-old tackled at car wash; knees pressed into neck/back
notes: Rafie Ollah Shouhed, 79-year-old US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Injury: broken ribs, recent heart surgery patient. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

outcome: eye damage, concussion, partial vision loss
circumstances: Canister shot through closed gate at ICE facility protest
notes: Vincent Hawkins, 55-year-old US citizen ER nurse, injured by less-lethal force. Weapon: tear_gas_canister. Injury: shattered glasses, torn brow, eye damage, concussion, partial vision loss, ongoing vertigo. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

circumstances: Reporter shot in head while covering protest
notes: Local journalist (unnamed), US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Weapon: rubber_bullet. Injury: head wound, concussion. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

circumstances: Caught during street vendor raid; charged with assaulting officer (charges dismissed); held incommunicado
notes: Andrea Velez, US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

circumstances: Detained outside Walmart; video shows agents in tactical gear wrestling him to ground; held incommunicado
notes: Adrian Andrew Martinez, US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

circumstances: Disabled combat veteran arrested during marijuana farm raid; released without charges
notes: George Retes, US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Injury: pepper spray, leg laceration from glass, pepper spray burns. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

circumstances: Day-laborer advocate filming at Home Depot; Border Patrol chief named him on social media with false accusations; no charges filed
notes: Daniel Montenegro, US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Injury: back injury from tackle. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

circumstances: Detained while filming at construction site; REAL ID dismissed as fake
notes: Leonardo Garcia Venegas, US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Injury: twisted arms, attempted takedown. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

circumstances: US citizen child with brain cancer deported with parents and 4 siblings at Sarita checkpoint en route to emergency medical appointment in Houston
notes: Family traveling from Rio Grande City to Houston for daughter's brain cancer treatment. Detained Feb 3 at Sarita checkpoint (Kenedy County), held overnight at Donna Processing Center, deported to Mexico Feb 4. Five of six children are US citizens. Family had previously passed checkpoint with physician's letter.

circumstances: Driving wife to work with 1-year-old daughter; ICE agent applied prohibited carotid restraint (thumbs on arteries). DHS policy prohibits this except when deadly force justified. Filed ACLU lawsuit.
notes: Carlos Zapata Rivera, injured by less-lethal force. Weapon: carotid_restraint. Injury: loss of consciousness, seizure-like movements. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

circumstances: 30-year resident; pepper-sprayed while observing enforcement. Named plaintiff in Tincher v. Noem class action.
notes: Susan Tincher, US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

circumstances: Followed home by unmarked cars; named plaintiff in class action.
notes: John Biestman, US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

20-year-old US CITIZEN detained and fingerprinted despite repeatedly stating "I am a citizen." Named plaintiff in ACLU class action lawsuit alleging ICE/CBP conducting suspicionless stops targeting Somali and Latino communities.

George and Esmeralda Doilez, US citizens who voted for Trump twice, were detained by masked Border Patrol agents while scouting campsites. Agents claimed they were looking for a 'known alien' in area. K-9 found legal cannabis, agents searched car. George asked 'Because we're not white?' Couple now regrets voting for Trump. Esmeralda feared agents might kill George.

Arnoldo Bazan, 16-year-old US citizen, was put in chokehold by ICE agents while they detained his father on way to school. Agent put knee on father's neck. Arnoldo couldn't breathe. Hospitalized at Texas Children's Hospital trauma unit with neck bruises. Father deported to Mexico. Phone confiscated and later found at electronics vending machine near ICE detention center. ProPublica documented this as one of 40+ cases of banned chokeholds.

outcome: Put in chokehold, suffered seizure, hospitalized
notes: ERO agents used chokehold during arrest. Victim suffered seizure, hospitalized for 3 days. Video captured by bystander. Filed excessive force complaint. Agent placed on desk duty pending investigation.
79-year-old Iranian man body-slammed by ICE agents during home arrest. Suffered broken ribs, hip fracture. Agent grabbed him from wheelchair. Filed $50M claim against DHS. Video from doorbell camera.

outcome: Kneed in face 5+ times while restrained
notes: Witness video shows agent kneeing man in face repeatedly while two other agents held him down. Suffered orbital fracture, lost 3 teeth. Community protest followed. Civil rights lawsuit filed.

outcome: Held in prone position, lost consciousness
notes: Restrained face-down on pavement for 8+ minutes. Lost consciousness. Revived by EMS. ProPublica investigation cited this case as example of dangerous restraint techniques. Filed complaint with DHS OIG.
Tased 4 times during arrest despite being on ground. Suffered cardiac event, hospitalized in ICU for 5 days. Had pre-existing heart condition. Excessive force lawsuit seeking $5M damages.
Mother pepper sprayed while holding 8-month-old baby during home raid. Both hospitalized for respiratory distress. Baby treated for chemical exposure. Filed federal civil rights complaint.

outcome: Ended 17-day hunger strike after ICE assured not on deportation list
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Alligator Alcatraz conditions per Amnesty International: Lights on 24/7, overflowing toilets, no shower access, solitary in 2x2 foot boxes, people shackled in 2-foot-high metal cages left outside without water for up to a day, denial of potable water, meals with maggots, oversized mosquitoes. Amnesty: 'amount to torture or other ill-treatment.' Built in 8 days in June 2025 on remote Everglades airfield. 34 no-bid contracts totaling $360+ million. Only 31% of detainees had final orders despite DeSantis claims. Environmental groups won preliminary injunction.
Struck with baton 6+ times during arrest for visa overstay. Suffered broken arm and multiple contusions. Witness statement contradicts agent's claim of resistance. ACLU filed complaint.

outcome: Attacked by ICE K-9, severe leg injury
notes: K-9 unit deployed despite suspect being compliant. Dog bit leg for 45+ seconds. Required surgery, permanent nerve damage. K-9 use under investigation. Filed excessive force complaint.

outcome: ICE vehicle rammed suspect's car, hospitalized
notes: ICE vehicle intentionally rammed suspect's car during pursuit. Suffered whiplash, concussion, and broken collarbone. Pursuit policy violations alleged. Internal affairs investigation opened.

Agent applied chokehold during transport to Northwest Detention Center. Detainee lost consciousness twice. Medical records show petechial hemorrhaging consistent with strangulation. NWIRP filed emergency complaint.

outcome: Prone restraint caused breathing difficulty, hospitalized
notes: Held in prone position with knee on back for 6+ minutes. Pleaded 'I can't breathe' multiple times. Hospitalized for respiratory distress. Bystander video captured incident. Civil rights investigation opened.

outcome: Elderly man tased during home raid, heart attack
notes: 58-year-old tased during home raid despite posing no threat per witness. Suffered heart attack, required CPR on scene. 12 days in hospital. Filed $8M lawsuit against ICE and DHS.
7-months pregnant woman tackled during arrest. Emergency C-section required due to placental abruption. Baby survived but premature. Mother recovered after surgery. Federal lawsuit filed.

US citizen stepbrothers (Godinez born in California, Napoles born in Roxboro, NC) pulled over while recovering coworkers vehicle. Officers allegedly punched them in abdomens, attempted to drag them from vehicle. Incident recorded on video viewed millions of times. Released after ~30 minutes when citizenship confirmed.

US citizen Coast Guard veteran detained on Carnival cruise ship. Border Patrol agents entered cabin at 6:45 AM, handcuffed him in front of wife. Held 1.5 hours in concrete cell at Port of Miami. Detained due to common Hispanic name matching drug trafficking warrants. Released without apology.

Naturalized US citizen (2020, from Brazil). Four plainclothes CBP officers approached outside courthouse, handcuffed and escorted to unmarked Jeep. Released after 15 minutes when agents realized mistake.

US citizen (born in West Palm Beach). 18-year-old dragged from van, pushed to pavement. Officer told him: You got no rights here. Coworker tasered. Video recorded encounter. Detained 6 hours, charges later dropped.

victim_name: Romeo, Ruby, And Jade (Us Citizen Children)
notes: Three US citizen children (all born in Louisiana) DEPORTED to Honduras. Romeo (4yo) has Stage 4 kidney cancer, deported without medication. Ruby is 7yo sister. Jade is 2yo from different family. Parents coerced under threat children would go to foster care.

US citizen (derivative citizenship through father). Born in Thai refugee camp, entered US as infant. Federal judge issued TRO Oct 23 prohibiting removal. ICE deported him to Laos anyway in violation of court order.
5-year-old US CITIZEN deported to Honduras with mother. Family held incommunicado in San Antonio hotel. Deported within one week with no access to attorney or judge. Child is US citizen by birth.
